intro: Heteropterys acapulcensis, commonly known as the Acapulco beauty, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded or semi-shaded areas within forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
